::: {#about-heading}
Hello! I’m Harrison Youn, an Economics PhD candidate researching Labor Economics, Health Economics, and Economics of Science and Innovation.
:::



 Back to top

title: Harrison Yongjoon Youn
text:
Harrison Yongjoon Youn

Economics PhD Candidate The Ohio State University


I am researching Labor Economic, Health Economics, and Economics of Science and Innovation.
In my research, I combine data and causal inference to answer my questions. I am particularly interested in how the labor market and healthcare system interact through various feedback channels, how changing incentives affect the behavior of employers and employees, and how market frictions, benefits, and costs are distributed across different actors.
I also study how human capital and labor market outcomes are shaped by scientific knowledge spillovers and innovation.
Previously, I served as a research associate at the National University of Singapore (NUS) for two years.

 CV

title: Harrison Yongjoon Youn
text:
Research Interests
My research spans several key areas in economics:

Labor Economics

Understanding employment dynamics, wage determination, and labor market policies

Health Economics

Examining the intersection of health outcomes and economic factors

Economics of Science and Innovation

Analyzing how economic incentives shape scientific research and technological advancement

title: Harrison Yongjoon Youn
text:
Contact
I’m always interested in discussing research collaborations and opportunities. Feel free to reach out through any of the channels above, or drop me an email at youn.25@osu.edu.
Currently based in Columbus, Ohio
